param

Class BigRational

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • param.BigRational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BigRational>

    public final class BigRational
extends java.lang.Number
implements java.lang.Comparable<BigRational>
    Provides a class to store big rational numbers. Numerator and denominator of a number stored using this class are not necessarily coprime. However, cancellation is applied by default. The special values infinity (INF), minus infinity (MINF) and not a number (NAN)are provided. For them, the usual rules apply (INF * INF = INF, MINF&INF=MINF, etc.), with the exception that INF+MINF=0, INF-INF=0, etc rather than NAN.
    Author:
    Ernst Moritz Hahn (University of Oxford)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • BigRational

        public BigRational(java.math.BigInteger num,
                   java.math.BigInteger den,
                   boolean cancel)
        Creates a new BigRational with value num / den. Whether cancellation between num and den is applied depends on cancel.
        Parameters:
        num - numerator of this BigRational
        den - denominator of this BigRational
        cancel - true to ensure resulting BigRational is coprime

      • doubleValue

        public double doubleValue()
        Returns a double approximation of value represented by this BigRational. There are no guarantees on preciseness currently, so this function should be mainly used for plotting graphs, etc. Can return Double.NaN, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY in case this BigRational represents not-a-number, positive infinity or negative infinitey respectively.
        Specified by:
        doubleValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        a double approximation of the rational represented by this object

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns the value of the specified number as an int, which may involve rounding or truncation.
        Note: In contrast to the standard Number.intValue() behaviour, this implementation throws an Arithmetic exception if the underlying rational number is not an integer or if representing as an int overflows.
        Positive and negative infinity are mapped to Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE, respectively, NaN is mapped to 0 (per the Java Language Specification).
        Specified by:
        intValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type int.

      • longValue

        public long longValue()
        Returns the value of the specified number as a long, which may involve rounding or truncation.
        Note: In contrast to the standard Number.longValue() behaviour, this implementation throws an Arithmetic exception if the underlying rational number is not an integer or if representing as a long overflows.
        Positive and negative infinity are mapped to Long.MAX_VALUE and Long.MIN_VALUE, respectively, NaN is mapped to 0 (per the Java Language Specification).
        Specified by:
        longValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type int.

      • isRational

        public boolean isRational()
        Returns true iff this object represents a true rational number. This excludes the values for not-a-number as well as positive and negative infinity.
        Returns:
        true iff this object represents a true rational number

      • isInteger

        public boolean isInteger()
        Returns true iff this object represents an integer, i.e., is not not-a-number, positive, or negative infinity and the denominator is 1.
        Returns:
        true iff this object represents an integer

      • isSpecial

        public boolean isSpecial()
        Returns true iff this value represents a special number. This is the case if this is either not-a-number, positive or negative infinity.
        Returns:
        true iff this object represents a special number

      • toBoolean

        public boolean toBoolean()
                  throws PrismLangException
        Returns true if this value equals 1 or false if this value equals 0. In all other cases, a PrismLangException is thrown.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • toApproximateString

        public java.lang.String toApproximateString()
        Return an approximate String representation (via conversion to double). If the conversion is imprecise, the result string is prefixed by '~'.

      • toInt

        public int toInt()
          throws PrismLangException
        Returns the int representation of this value, if this value is an integer and if the integer can be represented by an int variable. In all other cases, a PrismLangException is thrown.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException
